benefits.title: Improvement of aggressive behavior and quality of life impairment following S-Adenosyl-Methionine (SAM-e) augmentation in schizophrenia
benefits.summary: SAM-e administration led to some reduction in aggressive behavior and improved quality of life in schizophrenia patients with the low activity COMT polymorphism.

benefits.title: Covalent and Density-Controlled Surface Immobilization of E-Cadherin for Adhesion Force Spectroscopy
benefits.summary: SAM-e provides a novel and versatile platform to study molecular mechanisms underlying cadherin-mediated cell adhesion under defined experimental conditions.

benefits.title: S-adenosylmethionine (SAM-e) for the treatment of depression in people living with HIV/AIDS
benefits.summary: SAM-e treatment significantly reduces depressive symptomatology in HIV-seropositive individuals.

benefits.title: Alkanethiol Monolayer End Groups Affect the Long-term Operational Stability and Signaling of Electrochemical, Aptamer-based Sensors in Biological Fluids.
benefits.summary: SAM-e improves signaling and extends the operational life of in-vivo E-AB sensors from hours to days in biological fluids like serum.

benefits.title: Complementary and alternative medicine for the treatment of major depressive disorder.
benefits.summary: SAM-e monotherapy reduced depressive scores in 4 of 5 small randomized controlled trials.
benefits.journal: Canadian family physician Medecin de famille canadien

benefits.title: St. John's wort and S-adenosyl methionine as "natural" alternatives to conventional antidepressants in the era of the suicidality boxed warning: what is the evidence for clinically relevant benefit?
benefits.summary: SAM-e appears to be useful for the short-term treatment of mild-to-moderate depressive illness in adults.
benefits.journal: Alternative medicine review : a journal of clinical therapeutic

benefits.title: A pilot study of S-adenosylmethionine in treatment of functional abdominal pain in children.
benefits.summary: Oral SAM-e demonstrates promise in improving self-pain reports and quality of life in children with functional abdominal pain.
benefits.journal: Alternative therapies in health and medicine

benefits.title: Evidence for S-adenosyl-L-methionine (SAM-e) for the treatment of major depressive disorder.
benefits.summary: SAM-e is more efficacious than placebo and equal in efficacy to tricyclic antidepressants for treating major depressive disorder when administered parenterally.

benefits.title: Complementary and Alternative Medicine (CAM): considerations for the treatment of major depressive disorder.
benefits.summary: SAM-e may be appropriate to treat depression in some patients.

benefits.title: Beneficial effects of S-adenosyl-L-methionine on blood-brain barrier breakdown and neuronal survival after transient cerebral ischemia in gerbils.
benefits.summary: SAM-e reduces blood-brain barrier breakdown and neuronal death after transient cerebral ischemia in gerbils.

side effects.title: Improvement of aggressive behavior and quality of life impairment following S-Adenosyl-Methionine (SAM-e) augmentation in schizophrenia
side effects.summary: SAM-e administration led to some reduction in aggressive behavior and improved quality of life in schizophrenia patients, but two patients experienced exacerbation of irritability.

side effects.title: Severe Acute Malnutrition Results in Lower Lumefantrine Exposure in Children Treated With Artemether‐Lumefantrine for Uncomplicated Malaria
side effects.summary: SAM children are at risk of underexposure to lumefantrine and an increased risk of malaria reinfection compared to well-nourished children.

side effects.title: S-adenosylmethionine (SAM-e) for the treatment of depression in people living with HIV/AIDS
side effects.summary: SAM-e treatment significantly reduced depressive symptomatology in HIV-seropositive individuals.

side effects.title: A practical algorithm for the management of patients with statin-associated muscle symptoms.
side effects.summary: Statin-associated muscle symptoms (SAMS) range from mild weakness, cramps, and muscle pains to severe rhabdomyolysis, causing discontinuation of statin treatment and increased cardiovascular events.
side effects.journal: Hellenic journal of cardiology : HJC = Hellenike kardiologike epitheorese

side effects.title: Complementary and alternative medicine for the treatment of major depressive disorder.
side effects.summary: SAM-e monotherapy reduced depressive scores in 4 of 5 small randomized controlled trials.
side effects.journal: Canadian family physician Medecin de famille canadien

side effects.title: A pilot study of S-adenosylmethionine in treatment of functional abdominal pain in children.
side effects.summary: Oral SAM-e demonstrates improvement in self-pain reports and quality of life in children with functional abdominal pain, without causing liver toxicity or mania or depression.
side effects.journal: Alternative therapies in health and medicine

side effects.title: Association between statin use and physical function among community‐dwelling older Japanese adults
side effects.summary: Statin-associated muscle symptoms (SAMS) are muscle-related side-effects of statins, which may affect physical function in older adults.

side effects.title: Dynamic urine proteome changes in a rat model of simvastatin-induced skeletal muscle injury
side effects.summary: Statin-associated muscle symptoms (SAMS) are the main side effects of statins, and urine proteome changes can reflect early changes in the rat model.

side effects.title: Statin-Associated Muscle Disease: Advances in Diagnosis and Management
side effects.summary: Statin intolerance is most frequently associated with a range of side effects directed toward skeletal muscle, termed statin-associated muscle symptoms (SAMS).

side effects.title: Selective antimicrobial modulation of the intestinal flora of patients with acute nonlymphocytic leukemia: a double-blind, placebo-controlled study.
side effects.summary: SAM-e decreases the number of major acquired infections and does not cause substantial unfavorable side effects.

dosage.title: Improvement of aggressive behavior and quality of life impairment following S-Adenosyl-Methionine (SAM-e) augmentation in schizophrenia
dosage.summary: SAM-e (800 mg) administration for 8 weeks in chronic schizophrenia patients showed some reduction in aggressive behavior and improved quality of life.

dosage.title: S‐adenosyl‐methionine improves depression in patients with Parkinson's disease in an open‐label clinical trial
dosage.summary: SAM was administered in doses of 800 to 3600 mg per day for a period of 10 weeks in a pilot study.

dosage.title: A Phase 2 clinical trial of PF-05212377 (SAM-760) in subjects with mild to moderate Alzheimer’s disease with existing neuropsychiatric symptoms on a stable daily dose of donepezil
dosage.summary: SAM-760 was dosed at 30 mg once daily for 12 weeks in subjects with Alzheimer's disease on a stable dose of donepezil 5 to 10 mg daily.

dosage.title: Inhibition of mouse-killing behavior by S-adenosyl-L-methionine in midbrain raphe-lesioned and olfactory-bulbectomized rats
dosage.summary: SAM at doses of 180 and 320 mg/kg IP significantly inhibits mouse-killing behavior in both raphe-lesioned and olfactory-bulbectomized rats.

dosage.title: 1317. Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Ampicillin-Sulbactam (SAM) during Orthotopic Liver Transplantation (OLT)
dosage.summary: Current guidelines recommend a 3g dose of SAM, consisting of 2g ampicillin and 1g sulbactam, every 2 hours for surgical prophylaxis during Orthotopic Liver Transplantation.

dosage.title: Alkanethiol Monolayer End Groups Affect the Long-term Operational Stability and Signaling of Electrochemical, Aptamer-based Sensors in Biological Fluids.
dosage.summary: SAMs, formed from 1-hexanethiol solutions, decrease voltammetric charging currents of E-AB sensors by 3-fold and enable uninterrupted, continuous E-AB interrogation for several days in biological fluids like serum at 37°C.

dosage.title: A pilot study of S-adenosylmethionine in treatment of functional abdominal pain in children.
dosage.summary: Oral SAM-e demonstrates promise in treating functional abdominal pain in children, with a median dose of 1400 mg daily at the 2-mo follow-up period.
dosage.journal: Alternative therapies in health and medicine

dosage.title: Beneficial effects of S-adenosyl-L-methionine on blood-brain barrier breakdown and neuronal survival after transient cerebral ischemia in gerbils.
dosage.summary: SAM dosages range from 15-120 mg/kg for neuronal protection after transient cerebral ischemia in gerbils.

dosage.title: Dose-dependent bioavailability and metabolism of salicylamide in dogs.
dosage.summary: SAM dosage ranges from 5 to 40 mg/kg, with bioavailability increasing from 0.24 to 0.76 and clearance decreasing from 3.4 to 0.60 liters/min.
dosage.journal: The Journal of pharmacology and experimental therapeutics

dosage.title: S-adenosyl-L-methionine a counter to lead intoxication?
dosage.summary: SAM therapy is beneficial in the treatment of lead intoxication, with the best results obtained using 20 mg SAM/kg applied daily for 20-22 days.
dosage.journal: Comparative biochemistry and physiology. B, Comparative biochemistry
